posts.author: darktooth
posts.content:
nwnwiki: "Spell immunity grants complete protection from specified spells. This immunity is called by the spell resistance check, and serves as the second barrier to blocking magical attacks."

If a PC equips an item that makes one 'immune to spells level 4 and lower', does it mean he is still vulnerable to lesser spell breach, which does not check SR?
(There is an a 'lesser spell breach immunity' item property though.)

Edit: Playtested so I knew the answer to my question. PC would still be vulnerable to the breach, at least its SR lowering effect. Even immunity to LSB will still make the character vulnerable.
